body_html:
Ok - i think the fix was basically right - however it isn't fixed in the system clang 8.0.0 (which is in Sierra).

See the code around line 370 in https://github.com/darktable-org/darktable/blob/master/src/CMakeLists.txt

This references https://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=25510

Apparently it is something of an incompatibility between libgcc and clang compiler-rt. It is mentioned as fixed (Alina Sbirlea 2016-07-18 16:39:15 CDT This should be resolved by r275484.) but I guess it has not made it into apple clang 8.0.0.

I've hunted through the compiler-rt libraries and cannot find the symbol, so I conclude that it isn't in the Apple clang yet. I think I'll update the patch to rule out apple compilers of major 8 and below.

body:
Ok - i think the fix was basically right - however it isn't fixed in the system clang 8.0.0 (which is in Sierra). 

See the code around line 370 in https://github.com/darktable-org/darktable/blob/master/src/CMakeLists.txt

This references https://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=25510

Apparently it is something of an incompatibility between libgcc and clang compiler-rt.  It is mentioned as fixed (Alina Sbirlea 2016-07-18 16:39:15 CDT This should be resolved by r275484.) but I guess it has not made it into apple clang 8.0.0.

I've hunted through the compiler-rt libraries and cannot find the symbol, so I conclude that it isn't in the Apple clang yet.   I think I'll update the patch to rule out apple compilers of major 8 and below.
